content.detailedDescription: I laid down to go to bed and i was laying there staring out the window when i saw a white, seemingly large object that flew straight very fast. boomerang-shaped, all white. tips were thinner than the middle. no sound and nothing like i had ever seen. this was the same summer as my other report of a different object, though this was completely different. it left my sight very fast. i was scared, but it seemed to be flying towards the sky but not straight up, so i felt like if it was an alien, it was leaving.
content.summary: White boomerang-shaped object flying fast.

content.detailedDescription: I lived on a bay and a bright green light fell extremely fast from the sky, so fast that i expected to hear and see a crash, but it was silent. the bright green glowing object appeared to have landed, but it went from extremely fast to stopping in an instant. it landed across the bay in the forest, where i saw a green glow. i looked through binoculars and could only see a green glow, no object or movement. i watched it for about 3 hours, it was still glowing. there was definitely no glow there before the green light fell from the sky (unknown distance, i saw it from inside my house through a window). when the light fell it was so bright that it caught my attention while i was watching tv, saturday night live i believe. also i know it was in the summer, however i never recorded it so i do not know the exact date, it might not have even been the 2004 summer. anyway, i have really no explanation for this object being able to fall at an incredible speed and not hearing or seeing a crash, and then seeing it glow for hours. i fell asleep after watching the glow for about 3 hours. it was gone the next night, didnt see it during the next day.
content.summary: A bright green light fell extremely fast and landed and glowed for hours.

content.detailedDescription: I'm looking to talk to others with similar experiences.
content.summary: Light hovered left to right on the horizon.

content.detailedDescription: My sighting started with the light on the horizon and gets pretty unbeleivable from there. i'm looking to get in touch with other people with similar experiences.
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Path with directional change
content.summary: Bright on the horizon moved left then stopped then back right.

content.detailedDescription: At 9:07p.M. i got a call from my daughter in dewey, az that they were witnessing lights similar to the phoenix lights incident. they said from their point they appeared to be over prescott valley, where i live. looking towards their direction from my house i could see flashes from distant lightnening, but they said that the lightening was behind them and that it wasn't flashes, but sustained globes of light that were at first appearing and disappearing, then clustering, then began to "dance" around.  at one point they said it became a triangle, then a straight line. eventually, they moved off in different directions. after that she said it looked like "sparkles" and that she saw an airplane and could tell the difference. i stayed on the phone with my daughter for about a half an hour.  she was with several other people and i spoke to them, too.  what each said was pretty consistant among them. my daughter said she was so freaked out that she was shaking and she sounded legitimately upset.
content.summary: Dancing lights seen from dewey, az.

content.detailedDescription:
at approximately 2200 hrs on 1 july 2009 i was sitting on my deck, which faces south, when i noticed an object, which i thought was mars because it had a red cast to it, go from a stationary position and start moving south. it then made a sharp left turn and started moving east.  it then made a another left turn and started north. when it started it was about at a 45 degree angle in the southern sky and moved toward my location until it moved far enough north that i could not see it because it went out of my sight behind the deck cover.  about one minute later it reappeared from behind the deck cover heading south and stopped at about the position from which it started!  when i looked at it through my field glasses, it appeared to have flashing red and green lights on it. however, that could have caused by atmospheric conditions. i have no idea how high it was or the range.

i am a retired senior master sergeant after working 35 years for the oregon air national guard in avionics. when i retired in 1992 i was the avionics flight line superintendent at the 173rd fighter wing at kingsley field in klamath falls oregon, so i have been around aircraft all my adult life.  i never saw one that could come to a complete halt at altitude, start up again, make sharp turns and then return to a stationary position for almost and hour.

i have spent many hours the past 15 years on my deck here in medford after dark looking the at sky and watching airliners make their approach to medford. this is the first the time i have seen any thing strange.
content.summary: I was sitting on my deck at approx. 2200 hrs when i noticed an object i thought was mars start to move.

content.detailedDescription: I was outside smoking a cigarette approximately 9:53 pm et when i see this bright object moving through the sky very fast. at first i thought it was a satellite but it was brighter then all the other stars in the sky and brighter than any other satellite ive seen in the night sky. i rush inside and turn the porch light off to get a better view(i was inside for less then 5 seconds) when i notice the object had changed direction. the object was coming from my left going to the right and when i came back out it was going away from me. the was doing a very slight zig-zag motion when it was moving away from me, then the object disappeared. i observed the object for about 1 minute.
content.summary: Bright object, brighter then any satellite i have ever seen and brighter then any star in sky.

content.detailedDescription:
Yo soy ingeniero civil trabajo desde el 2004 para covial una dependencia del ministerio de comunicaciones e infraestructura de guatemala, en el mantenimiento de la red vial como supervisor, y debemos mensualmente entregar  informes de cada trabajo realizado por los contratistas que tenemos bajo nuestra supervisi���n, y para el efecto siempre debemos llevar una camara o algun dispositivo para tomar fotograf���as a los trabajos realizados.
esa tarde viajaba de huehuetenango para la parte alta (san pedro soloma) y al ver que el sol caia me dispuse buscar el mejor lugar que me diera tiempo para tomar una fotograf���a de la caida del sol, detuve mi vehiculo y apenas me di��� tiempo para tomarle una foto, cuando revise si la habia tomado me percate de que en el centro del sol se veia un punto, pero pense que era suciedad del lente, luego continue mi camino.  al d���a siguiente en mi oficina baje las fotograf���as a mi computadora son la curiosidad de ampliar la foto de la caida del sol para ver que era ese punto y lo unico que parece es una esfera, lo cual me causo extra���esa.  
espero que la puedan analizar y si es posible enviarme un correo de los resultados de sus estudios.  
gracias.
content.summary: Parece una esfera.

content.detailedDescription: I was driving home from a friends house at about 11 pm on june 30th 09. i thought i was seeing an airplane about to crash into the ground 2 mins from me. i was so scared because i thought it would blow up right there in front of me. it was going so fast twards the ground and then stopped abruptly. it hovered for a second and took off really fast twards the left at a 45 degree angle.It was so strange so i started to pay attention. then it looked like it was about to crash a second time, but didnt once again. about 1 min later i was driving right next to the thing. the lights were really really bright. big white lights and smaller blue ones in a pattern. [white, blue, white, blue and so on]. not like any aircraft i have seen.It was hovering 3-4 feet over a field. then it took off past me right as i was driving by. there were a few people pulled over behind me so im sure they were watching it too.
content.summary: It was flying really fast, with really bright lights.

content.detailedDescription: I was heading home from work, south bound on i95. it was a nice day and i was noticing how picturesque the sky looked. i have seen a few unusual cloud formations recently and have become fond of taking pictures of them. i saw an amazing cloud bank straight ahead over the high way, and thought wow this would be a nice shot. i had my camera on the seat right next to me, but decided that trying to take a picture wile driving was a bad idea. then i saw what at first glance looked like a plain, but then i realized i never see plains flying across this part oh the highway. the other thing was that it was black and did not appear to have wings or any vertical control surfaces. just as i was trying to figure out what this could be it vanished right before my eyes. i attempted to rationalize what i saw by telling myself it flew into the clouds, but the object never changed altitude and it was well below the clouds. the part that really got me going happened about three minutes after the object disappeared.  i saw a fighter jet flying from the direction the object originally came from. it was moving conspicuously fast and then it accelerated out of sight. the fighter looked like an f18.
content.summary: The object was black and cigar shaped.

content.detailedDescription: Witness states that at 9:48 she was talking on her cell phone outside and looking up at the stars.  between 9:48 and 10:15, three "stars" ended up moving.  one went east, one went north, and one went south.
content.summary: 3 objects that had appeared to be stars began moving in different directions.

content.detailedDescription:
Witness's story in her words: 

to escape the noise while talking with my sis on my phone, i went outside, laid on the trampoline and as usual, looked at the stars. there were even more than usual. i usually check them every night, in hopes of seeing a shooting star or something unexplainable. while on the phone, what i thought was a stationary star suddenly began to float [for lack of a better word] across the sky. over the next hour five more 'stars' did the same thing. one time a plane flew near as one was floating or gliding off. three other stars just disappeared all together. i did see a shooting star..It was orangish and went down fast. or maybe it was a meteor. are there meteors that seem to be stars? do they go so slow??? i have seen several meteor showers in my life. this was not like that. only two of these 'stars' [at a time] flew in the same direction and i watched them until they glided out of view...I do have limited view... they were white like stars, small like stars and made no sound. both planes i saw tonight made sound.
content.summary: Moving "stars"

content.detailedDescription: As i was walking up my hallway this morning, i looked up at my cathedral windows and noticed a giant bright object at about 50deg in the eastern sky.  it remained there for about 30 minutes and disappeared. about the only way i can describe it is it looked like the largest, brightest star i've ever seen and i'm an astrologer.
content.summary: Very large bright object hovering in eastern sky.

content.detailedDescription:
While on a visit to see our son at his phoenix residence, we (my wife, son, my son's girl friend, and myself) were relaxing by the pool on a typical hot phoenix afternoon. while laying on a pool side lounge chair i noticed what appeared to be a star visible at mid-day in a bright cloudless sky. the object was a faint amber light that was difficult to see and i wondered how it would be possible to see any star in such daylight conditions. i removed my perscription sun glasses to view the object with my naked eyes just to ensure myself that the object was not an artifact caused by the lenses. the object was visisble to my normal vision also. i watched the object remain motionless for a few minutes and then noticed another faint amber light to the southwest of the object apparently appear out of thin air. the two objects then began to close on one another and appeared to get rather close and then seperate. it was at this time that i alerted my son, wife, and girl friend who were in the pool to look up to see if they could locate the objects i was pointing out. the women gave up looking after a few quick glances skyward. my son stuck with me and climbed out of the pool to sit behind me so i could point and direct his sight toward the objects. at  that time one of the objects began to change brightness and color becoming much more visible and he picked it up. the brighter object began an erratic zig zag pattern of decent, then climbing higher into the sky and then a movement toward the west. a high flying airliner became visible as it flew west to east and we could easily estimate that the objects we were viewing were much higher than the aircraft which appeared to be above 35k feet.

we commented back and forth about what the objects might be as two or three other small amber lights appeared in that portion of the sky. we ruled out satelites because of the motions the objects were exhibiting, as well as birds catching sunlight. we were convinced that the objects were intelligently controlled, very high and wondered if they were experimental aircraft. then one of the objects began exhibiting a strange flight that resembled a bow-tie or highly angular object floating down from a high altitutde like a leaf falling from a tree on a windy day. the object grew brighter and changed (flickered) from white to blue to green to orange back to bright white and blue as it seemed to decend closer to us. we both were very excited by what we were seeing as well as confused and filled with more than a bit of wonder as to what they were and what it might mean. we viewed the objects for up to a half an hour before the objects appeared to increase in altitude and move out of sight to the west. 

we had a camera available but because of the daylight conditions and the apparent size of the objects in the sky, i believed we had no chance of actually getting a decent shot so i never tried to take a picture.
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Multiple star like and angular light objects exhibiting erratic flight, color, and size changes.

content.detailedDescription: At 0330 hrs. i walked out front deck to feed the cat, then stopped a minute to have a cigarette. i was looking up in the sky towards the west when i saw a fiery object flying at a very rapid speed twoards our home , it did then fly right over our house, only a couple hundred ft. above the tree line, we have tall pines on our property so they are about 100 ft. tall...The object was not that high up, i could see it clearly...Reminded me of a childs baton, a long stick with a bulb at each end...The center was dim, but the 2 lights at each end were fiery color and bright. the object was soundless, it was not a very large object, about the length of an old toyota car best i can explain. it went over so fast i didnt'have time to wake my husband or get the camera, i did run around the house to see it again but by the time i got out back the object was gone.  please note the object did disturb our cat out front, the cat was very upset for about half hour after the event...I have never seen anything like that, was kind of disturbing to me also.
content.summary: Ufo shot over our house at a rapid speed, stick shaped object with 2 fiery balls at each end, center was dim. soundless.

content.detailedDescription: We were on break from 9:00 to 9:25. noticed a strange colored object approaching from the south, heading northewest. the first thing we noticed was the color. the orange color caught our attention. it moved slowly from south to northeast. i dont know why, but the color and shape changed, from time to time. i just thought it was a plane, but there was no strobe from the oblect, and i know planes strobe. the thing that clinched it for me was when the object made an "l" turn left, at a good speed. the object slowed, and then went straight up into the clouds. we were shocked at the speed it went up. we never saw it again.
content.summary: Strange orange color, started as circle and changed colors.

content.detailedDescription: July 1, 2009, going home (west) hwy2, michigan city, in. wife and husband about 8:30 p.M. (dusk) when suddenly on the outskirts of town we observed what i thought to be an ingenious 4th of july stunt. as it became closer i realized we were seeing something truly unique. yes, a real ufo! the craft had a dark mass underneath and a bright orange/yellow bright light spuing out an aura of same. it continued at a steady speed approximately 70 mph at about 500 feet in height. i could not pull over so continued on as it passed directly over our vehicle. wife put her head out of the window, looking straight up at the bottom of the craft, and saw what i have drawn, the bottom was flutted black/gray with indentations, with a round, bright light of orange/yellow in the middle and she probably got the best view of it. i then found a parking lot, pulled in, ran out and grabbed the binoculars. the height of the craft had increased by this time to about 800 feet and i zeroed in on it. the bright, flaring light had dimmed to a ring of continuous light of the same vibrant red/orange color and distinctive black round disk-like rearend. there was no noise. it gained in altitude to about 1500 feet and my wife said it made a slight curve (turn) but maintained speed. just then another motorist pulled in beside us to ask- what the heck is that??!! he and his son saw it too. i watched as it disappeared out of sight, and gained more height. there is no reasonable explanation for this sighting. it had no wings so that its slow speed would invariably send it stalling to the ground. no balloon i know of could have such a varied light show this displayed with such intensity. i am a recreational pilot, and have a good sense of height and size. the size was approximately 30 feet in diameter.
content.summary: Michigan city, in, july 1, 2009; bright orange/yellow light with black/grayish flutted edges, round.

content.detailedDescription: I had just left work about 5:00 pm and noticed a large number of jet contrails cris-crossing the sky.  i live within 75 miles of seymour-johnson afb and cherry point marine air station so jet contrails are common place, but had never seen the large number i saw that afternoon (approx. 12 jets).  the contrails were very high in the sky.  i noticed what appeared to be a contrail that looked different than the others in that it was blunt on both ends, not narrow just behind the jet and wider as the jet moved away.  i could see the jets just in front of the other contrails but not this one.  it looked so unusual that i pulled over and got out of my truck so i could watch it a little closer.  i then realized that this one particular contrail was much lower to the ground than the others and it was still blunt on both ends and was not growing longer as a normal jet contrail would as the jet moved through the air.  as i said, i could not see any jet near this contrail.  as i looked at it i realized that it wasn't a contrail at all, but was a mettalic looking object, silver gray in color, just hanging (hovering) in the air.  i could see what appeared to be facets along the edge.  it was about the size and shape of a silver dollar held out at arm's length and the right side was approximately 45 degree angle from the ground.  i could not believe what i was seeing, but the longer i watched it the more certain that i was that it was some kind of a flying craft.  it did not appear to have a dome on top like pictures i have seen.  it was flat on top and bottom and appeared to be disk shaped and i was looking directly at the edge (side).  while i was watching this the jets were continuing to criscross the sky but at a much higher elevation that the object i was seeing.  it seemed as if the jets were searching for something.  i watched it for about two minutes more and it began to shorten on both ends untill it was gone.  i assumed that it traveled directly away from me at a high rate of speed and this is what made it appear to "shorten" on both ends.  the sun had just gone beneath the horizen but the sky was completely bright so my visability was very good.  there was no glare from the sun and no clouds - a beautiful day.  i never reported it and never saw anything in the paper on on the news about it.
content.summary: Noticed many jet contrails high elevation.  observed ufo below contrails.

content.detailedDescription:
This object was observed in pasadena at the caltech campus, just off wilson avenue to the west, at 8pm. it was heading north at quite a slow speed. i had just finished work and was heading over to the parking structure. there is a nice open space with a good view of the sky and i was taking in the view whilst walking. this is when i noticed the object, which was silhouetted clearly. 

at first i thought it was a helicopter as they're quite common around here. i also thought it might be a bird gliding high up. closer scrutiny showed none of these to be the case.

it was perfectly black, and could be seen clearly against the sky, which was still light as the sun hadn't set yet. what i observed literally was a perfectly round, black spot that changed shape to a thin line and back again, with a period of about 5 seconds. it looked to me a like a disc that was rotating about its planar axis, to give the appearance of a spot that was alternating its shape with that of a thin line. it was travelling along the direction of its axis of rotation, towards the north before it got lost to my vision behind other buildings and trees. i tried to find it again after getting on my motorcycle and heading north, but to no avail. as i mentioned, it's speed was relativity slow, and it was not moving in a straight line. it was meandering and hovering, but it's general direction was north.

from its movement, i estimate that it was about 1km away and had a diameter of 50-100 metres (very subjective of course).
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Black ufo, round disc shape that was rotating about its planar axis.

content.detailedDescription: I was driving home when i saw a bright orb hovering at a low altitude. i thought it was a plane at first.It was a bright sphere shaped object .I didnt manage to get a picture because  it starting rising then  moving in a opposite direction.
content.summary: Bright hovering orb

content.detailedDescription:
Weeks prior to event, i planned on taking son and fiance with me for our 1st time visit to gilliland ranch (trout lake, wa) but my son's high-school football practice schedule recently confirmed conflicting summer scheduling.  i have been disappointed because my fiance and son have been cynical of ufos and have made jest of my personal experience a decade ago in mount shasta.  

we were traveling n to reno between beatty & tonopah (nevada) with fiance driving.  i was watching night sky through our sunroof and side windows hoping to see a "power-up" sphere commonly seen at gilliland ranch but resolving it would be most improbable.

as we traveled between beatty and tonopah, i saw a light traveling n over the mountains to the east at about 3 o'clock with respect to our vehicle.  i pointed it out to my son in the back seat.  my fiance caught sight of it as well.  while we watched it, the star-like entity grew to incredible brightness whereby a large halo of light surrounded it.  shortly after comments of awe from my son and fiance, it began to dim as it traveled n reaching about 1 o'clock with respect to our vehicle.  my son followed its traveling while in a dimmed state for a few seconds longer and commented it's "weird" traveling path.  i could not see it after dimming.

after we arrived in reno, i googled the map and discovered it was within the western proximity of the nv test site and area 51.  

it was not frightening.  both my fiance and son confirmed their feelings of having seen a ufo.  i felt relief and satisfaction that my son had experienced what he could have seen if he could travel with us to gilliland ranch later this summer.  

ironically, prior to our reno trip, i had just received the materials for mufon testing to be a field investigator.  i doubt my son and fiance will be making jest of ufos any longer.
content.summary: Star-like traveled n, increased to large sphere with halo-like brightness, faded.

content.detailedDescription:
I have been going to the same dark sky location near millersville, missouri for several years.  i go to this place because it is a good location for star gazing as well as ufo hunting. i had not seen anything that i would call a ufo until the past several weeks.

i believe the first ufo sightings i had at this location started on june 6, 2009. i saw several objects that looked like stars except for the fact that they were moving and changing brightness. i assumed what i was seeing were satellites until i got on nasas website and did some research on visible satellites.

after doing my research, i realized that what i was seeing did not fit the criteria for orbiting satellites.  for one thing, the objects i was seeing were traveling across the sky faster than what nasas website showed most satellites travel. another thing that seemed strange was the fact that almost all of the objects i saw changed brightness as they moved across the sky.  several of them would periodically get so bright that they would look to be several times the brightness of venus.  when the objects increased in brightness it also appeared that their size was increasing.  i would estimate the size to be 3 to 4 times the size of venus when looking through 10x binoculars.

most of the objects i saw traveled in a straight path across the sky until they got so dim that i couldn't see them anymore. one object did move from off of its straight line course and changed direction. i knew that this particular object could not be a satellite.

on june 26, 2009, i saw 8 of these objects between 10:00-10:40pm cdt. this is another thing that made me think that these can't all be satellites because i don't believe that 8 satellites would have orbital paths that would take them over the same location in that short a period of time.

the reason i sited the date of the event as june 27, 2009, is because that night i was able to get a short video of one of the objects on a camcorder i borrowed from my brother.

as of monday, june 29, i am still seeing the objects. i plan to continue to go to the sight to try and gather more video evidence.
content.summary: Short film of one of several similar objects that i saw that night.

content.detailedDescription: We saw a solid white light, not airplane flashing lights, above crossing  over our heads in a very fast manor. afterwards, we saw and heard commercial jets, not the same look.  20 minutes later we saw it again, it got really bright and bigger for about 2 seconds then the light went back to a small dot that kept on getting smaller and not moving across the sky but getting smaller in a stationary position untill we could not see it.
content.summary: Flew very fast, solid white light. round.

content.detailedDescription:
this saucer was flying up and down like a thrown rock skimming off the water.
after i saw it i went inside to ask my father to come out and see ! he refused. he read it in the san francisco examiner the next morning. thounsands of people saw it and reported it.    tks. ronald harris
content.summary: it was disk shaped and fast moving. flying from the west to the east  at  about  600 mi.Per. hr.

content.detailedDescription: I was at home,sweeping the deck and star watching. i stopped and took notice of it because of the size of the lights. came over the tree line from the east. i thought could this be an airplane? thought,"look at the angle of the bottom light. the other two sightings were straight on the wings.Chevron shaped 8 lights flew in from the east. the corner of the right side,was turned up and that light on the end was sitting up and to the side. i believe it is like the phoenix lights pics. not sure if it was the phoenix lights pics but have seen this before. like a check mark backwards, on the right side and straight on the otherside. 8 lights, 4 on each side. no noise on a quiet night. almost stopped and turned a circle and went northeast, slightly north and more east. low in the sky. i couldnt make out a body of the craft. judging the shape by the lights. this has happened 3 times in the last 2 weeks. last sighting, june 30,2009. appx. 1am i am normally not too impressed with lights in the night. but the size of the lights were the size of a dime held out at arms length.  this could have been an aircraft. but flew too low. judging the size of the ship by the lights would make this craft larger than our commercial aircraft. height about 200-300 yards. size of the light formation, about 100 yards, it was big.
content.flightPath: Straight-line path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Chevron shaped 8 lights flew in from the east.

content.detailedDescription: At about 4am.  the wind started blowing very hard. i woke-up and coming over a cliff i saw what looked like a building going over head slowly.  it was low enough i could see shapes and objects on it.  my brother myself and a friend (he is a deputy sheriff now) saw 5-6 objects in the sky making zig-zag patterns in the sky in fractions of a second. on a clear night full moon. around 10pm.
content.summary: Like a 7-8 story building on its side.

content.detailedDescription: After returning from nyc on a business trip, i had my mom and girlfriend over for a bbq and some time in the pool enjoying the sun (108f that day) when the sun finally set my gf and i enjoyed some quality time sitting on my extended patio looking up into the night sky. i was remembering my childhood and those summer nights spent hunting for satellites, looking for planets, and watching the jets come into sfo doing their modesto three arrivals of which i was just a part of as i recently flew in on a delta flight from jfk-sfo. the coolest thing was actually counting 8 satellites of which 3 were circumpolar. my gf is a nurse and had to get up early on monday morning so she asked if i wouldn't mind if she laid down for a bit because she was tired. so she goes in the house, i grab my favourite recliner and lay back to count more satellites. i had an idea to grab my night vision binoculars and did. i love the night sky and have been looking at it since i was a boy. i decided to put them away after about ten minutes and went back to just looking straight up with my naked eye. just then out of the corner of my eye i see something that grabs my attention. at first i thought, what a big bird that is, then after looking at it more intensely i decided it was a bunch of orange ballons drifting from nw to sw. as i lookedmore i realized that there was not any wind at so at because of the record 108 temps we had that day. so, i stared and stared even saying out loud, "what the hell is that?" what i saw had fuzzy edges, but also like it was made up of objects that were round glowing orange like when metal is heated. it moved so elegant and so straight. not fast, and not too high because of the duration that i saw it (25 secs) also, it did not disappear of trees but rather into the haze of the night sky. funny thing, satellites never go all the way across the sky because at some point they are no longer in a direct path of the sun to reflect light. i was so excited with seeing this thing that i ran into the house and woke my gf up telling her every detail. again, orange, glowing appearance, moving in straight line, not too fast but elegantly, made up of circular round looking light sources, and disappeared into the haze of the sky. i'd like to hear any explaination available for what this thing was. i'm a private piolt and an amateur astronomer enthusiast and i have never seen anything like this.
content.summary: Orange glowing, straight line moving, looked like a few circles glowing together, disappeared into haze.

content.detailedDescription: I left from where i go to take dual enrollment classes.  i got on to state road 80 and started heading east.  as soon as i got on the road i noticed a blinking light i figured it was some plane and didn't think to much about it. when i first saw the object it was about eight miles.I kept driving and the object seemed to be stationary and it wasn't moving. i got within a mile or so the  object started moving at a cars speed.  it was following the road and there was alot traffic going east and west. i saw the object had a blinking light on the top of it i figured it was probably a helicopter.  i kept driving and then i noticed the object started to slow down a little.  then i driving right next to it and then i knew it was something else.  it had the blinking light on the top and then it had five lights underneath it.  the lights were going around in a pattern i have never seen before.  about six to five miles away from getting on to u.S. 27 the object crossed the road and started heading north i turn to look at the road and i looked back and it was gone.  i never got a good look to see what the object's shape because it was already dark outside.
content.summary: Weird.

content.detailedDescription:
I was on my balcony on a clear june night around dusk, but still pleantly of light in the sky.  i walked out on my 3rd story appartment balcony to enjoy a cigarette, and my eyes were immediatley drawn to the horizon to the east, where i saw a huge dark object, like a cigar laying horizontally, and it seemed to slowly float, it was more like a bouncing or skipping, but it almost seemed to move in slow motion.  i've never seen anything move like that in my life.

i yelled for my girlfriend and my 7 year old son to come outside and look to make sure i was seeing what i was seeing, they were both stunned and had no idea what it could have been.

we were watching it float from north to south togeather for about 1 minute, and then it dissapeared.  literally just dissapeared.  no lights turned on, nothing.  it was there, plain as day, then it was gone.

i called eppley airfield & the local police station to ask them if anyone had reported seeing anything strange in the sky, because i had, and the operator snickered and told me no.

what i saw was like nothing i've ever seen, and i hope everyone gets a chance some day to have the same experience.  it was very exciting, it made me feel like a giddy little kid.

now that i have seen one, its very frustrating to me how people just laugh it off.  even when a report is so credible that it makes it to the evening news, every time, the anchorpeople laugh it up & don't take it seriously causing the people watching not to take it seriouly.
content.summary: See detailed description.

content.detailedDescription: I was sitting on my couch and heard a loud rumbling. i looked out my back window and saw 5 ships all aligned horizontal moving very slow and about 35 feet off the ground. in just a few seconds they disappeared behind the tree line which is about 200 yards from where i was watching.
content.summary: 5 ships very close to each other.
